attributes.action: Bring uk fuel prices in line with the european prices, especially as we are supossed to be part of the EU
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Why is it when you travel to france, spain and other european countries you usually pay around 1 euro for a litre of fuel, which by a rough calculation is around 70p/ltr. Yet in the uk, we pay around 98p/ltr. We are all supposed to be part of the EU yet there are such varying prices. It is unjust and is another labour stelth tax. It does not detur peoiple from using their cars, it meerly punishes people who have to use their cars in order to actually earn a living. Please sign the petition and email a link to everyone you know, asking them to do the same! With enough signatures, someone will have to listen! thanks

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Bring uk fuel prices in line with the european prices, especially as we are supossed to be part of the EU."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page18015


Prime Minister's Office
